name: Fruit Salad
history: Fruit salad is enjoyed worldwide, with variations seen in different cultures. Typically, it's a dish consisting of various kinds of fruit, sometimes served in a liquid, either their own juices or a syrup.
description: This Fruit Salad is a refreshing mix of various fresh fruits, each contributing its unique taste and texture. It includes apples, oranges, grapes, strawberries, and bananas, making it a colorful and nutritious dish suitable for any occasion.

instructions.title: Prepare the Fruits
instructions.description: Wash, peel as necessary, and cut all the fruits into bite-sized pieces. Place them in a large mixing bowl.

instructions.title: Add Flavorings
instructions.description: Drizzle lemon juice over the cut fruits to prevent browning. Add honey or maple syrup if a sweeter taste is desired. Gently toss to combine.

instructions.title: Chill and Serve
instructions.description: Refrigerate the salad for at least an hour before serving. This allows the flavors to meld together.

instructions.title: Garnish
instructions.description: Garnish with fresh mint leaves just before serving.

tips: Choose ripe but firm fruits for the best texture and flavor.
You can customize the salad with seasonal fruits of your choice.
variations: Add a sprinkle of cinnamon or a splash of orange juice for extra flavor.
Include other fruits like kiwi, pineapple, or melon for more variety.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed on the same day. Can be refrigerated for up to 24 hours.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

presentationTips: Serve in a clear glass bowl to showcase the colorful fruits.
Top with a dollop of yogurt or a scoop of ice cream for a dessert twist.
